alert.note: Alert for Greenville Mountains; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 20 at 3:51AM EST until January 20 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...The Carolina mountains and Rabun County in Georgia. * WHEN...Until noon EST today. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Greenville Mountains; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains
